tp:simple-type.name: Message_Body
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: The UTF-8 encoded XML body of a Ytstenut message.

tp:mapping.name: Message_Attrs
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A list of attributes present on a Ytstenut message.

property.name: RequestType
property.tp:docstring: The <iq> type of the request message.

property.name: RequestAttributes
property.tp:docstring: The attributes present on the Ytstenut request message.

property.name: RequestBody
property.tp:docstring: The UTF-8 encoded XML body of the Ytstenut request message. The top level element must have the name 'message' and be of the namespace 'urn:ytstenut:message'. Any attributes in the RequestAttributes property will override any attributes of the same names on the top level element. If an empty string is used as the RequestBody then a default body will be used instead.

signal.name: Replied

arg.name: Attributes
arg.tp:docstring: The attributes present on the Ytstenut result message.

arg.name: Body
arg.tp:docstring: The UTF-8 encoded XML body of the Ytstenut result message, including the attributes in the

signal.tp:docstring: This signal is emitted when a <iq type='result'> is received in response to a request sent on this channel. This signal is only emitted on the initiating side of the channel.

signal.name: Failed

arg.name: ErrorType
arg.tp:docstring: The type of error which defines the appropriate action to take.

arg.name: StanzaErrorName
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the specific error.

arg.name: YtstenutErrorName
arg.tp:docstring: A more detailed Ytstenut error name.

signal.tp:docstring: This signal is emitted when a error is received. This signal is only emitted on the initiating side of the channel.

method.name: Request
method.tp:docstring: Send the Ytstenut request (represented by the RequestType, RequestAttributes and RequestBody) properties to the other side of this channel.

method.name: Reply

arg.name: Attributes
arg.tp:docstring: The attributes to set on the Ytstenut reply message.

arg.name: Body
arg.tp:docstring: Optional UTF-8 encoded XML body of the Ytstenut reply message. The top level element must have the name 'message' and be of the namespace 'urn:ytstenut:message'. Any attributes in the Attributes argument will override any attributes of the same names on the top level element. If an empty string is used as the Body then a default body will be created instead.

method.tp:docstring: Send a <iq> result to the Ytstenut request.

arg.name: ErrorType
arg.tp:docstring: The type of error which defines the appropriate action to take.

arg.name: StanzaErrorName
arg.tp:docstring: The name of the specific error.

arg.name: YtstenutErrorName
arg.tp:docstring: A more detailed Ytstenut error name.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The iq request is of type 'get'
The iq request is of type 'set'
The iq reply is of type 'result'
The iq reply is of type 'error'
Do not retry (the error is unrecoverable)
Proceed (the condition was only a warning)
Retry after changing the data sent
Retry after waiting (the error is temporary)

tp:docstring.p: When a channel of this type is created by calling CreateChannel(), the RequestType, RequestAttributes (and optionally RequestBody) properties should be specified. The request is sent while the channel is created.
